intro: Gnidia marunguensis, commonly known as the Marunguena gum tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Gnidia marunguensis is also valued for its hard, durable wood, which has been used traditionally for various purposes.
